channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Keep left bollard, 31st January
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish and food over pavement again, 31st January
item.description:
Rubbish and food over the pavement again. This is a daily occurrence. Please address the cause and put up a camera or speak to residents as this is everyday. This is a health hazard and absolutely disgusting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress fly tipping, 31st January
item.description:
There has been 2 mattresses dumped on the green. One on the left side one on the right.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Voce Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Hazard on footpath, 31st January
item.description:
This is the pavement outside 71/73 Clarendon Green, BR5 2NZ. This footpath has been deteriorating for a long time but due to recent very bad weather it is rapidly getting worse. This is a pathway I use to pick up/ drop off a disabled person at 75 Clarendon Green. It is very difficult to get a walker or wheelchair to the road and my car. A serious accident waiting to happen for any walker, even more so for an elderly person, especially in wet weather.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, Clarendon Green, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4th time reporting this, 31st January
item.description:
Reporting again, fourth time now. Council said it was sorted & also they couldn’t find problem: Bookshelf & large box fly tipped in communal areas of Havil street flats on the first floor. This is a fire risk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Havil Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
